sub_title: Associate Professor at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam
summary:
Being an associate professor in the field of social marketing, risk/health communication as well as media psychology at the Department of Communication Science of the Faculty of Social Sciences (Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam), I approach my research and teaching from an interdisciplinary perspective. 

My research projects pertain to social marketing of prosocial behavior (communication strategies for negotiating media effects on body image; and for pro-environmental behavior); media processing in a social context (media-peer-influences on body image/well-being); risk/health communication applications; with a special focus on the social context and on individual & diversity aspects.

I graduated in Biomedical Sciences (Master of Science, with a specialization in Science Communication and Education) and obtained a master degree in Biology Education (Lerarenopleiding Biologie), while I was also a visiting scholar of the University of Namibia, Windhoek/rural upper north. In more recent years, I was a visiting scholar at Flinders University (Adelaide, Australia), the Ohio State University (Columbus, OH, USA), the University of Cape Town (SA), and in coastal regions of Namibia (various stakeholders). 

Specific research projects:
- Media-by-peer interactions impacting youngsters' body image and well-being (social context of media processing; peer influences, norms, social comparison; normalization, idealization and counteracting effects)
- Researcher in the Expertisegroup Cosmetic Procedures (social media in relation to cosmetic procedure norms and behavior)
- Researcher in collaboration with GGZ Rivierduinen/Eetstoornissen Ursula (social media in relation to eating disorder symptomatology)
- Research-based body image interventions to restore adolescents’ perceptions of ideal and ‘normal’ bodies (based on serious gaming and tailoring health information)
- YourTern Project: evidence-based environmental education program (PI; program development and evaluation), using amongst others comics/storytelling and gamification to target schoolgoing children in Namibia
- The impact of emotional appeals (i.e., variations in visual and verbal content in narratives) in the domain of health communication, specifically in HIV/Aids stigmatization

Teaching:
- Communication Campaigns and Research 
- Social marketing (for Behavioral Change; Environmental Issues and Health)
- Health Education
- Risk - and Health Communication
- Individual Processing of Media 
- Supervision MA-theses and research (master) internships
- PhD supervision

awards.title: Science for Impact Best Paper Award - Communication Science VU Amsterdam
awards.description: ‘Science for Impact Best Paper Award 2018’ as awarded by the students from ‘Science for Impact’, Communication Science, for: Veldhuis, J., Konijn, E. A., & Knobloch-Westerwick, S. (2017). Boost your body: Self-improvement magazine messages increase body satisfaction in young adults. Health communication, 32(2), 200-210.

(2017). Brain Activation upon Ideal-Body Media Exposure and Peer Feedback in Young Females.

Weight information labels on media models reduce body dissatisfaction in adolescent girls. Journal of Adolescent Health, 50(6), 600-606.

authors.headline: Associate Professor at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam

profile_positions.title: Associate Professor (Social Marketing of Prosocial Behavior; Risk/Health Comm; Media Psychology)

profile_positions.description:
Research: 
- Combined effects of (social) media, peer influences and social comparison among adolescents and young adults on *body image and well-being* as well as *pro-environmental behaviors* 
- Communication strategies and health communication applications (using social media) to negotiate the effects of media exposure, peer influence, and individual processing of media
- External research collaboration: on the impact of social media on body image in women with eating disorders (informing interventions and policy)
- External research collaboration: on associations between social media, social context factors and cosmetic procedures
- External research collaboration: on effective health strategies to reduce hiv-stigma
- External research collaboration: on effective communication strategies to promote nature conservation

Teaching: 
- Graduate and undergraduate level (course coordination, development, teaching and evaluation of educational activities (courses taught in Dutch and English, course also provided for Department of Health Sciences)
- PhD supervision
- Master theses supervision
- Research master internship supervision

Other relevant academic activities, amongst others:
- Elected secretary for the Information Systems Division of the International Communication Association
- Research visit to Flinders University, Adelaide, Australia; joint research project
- Research visit to the Ohio State University, Columbus, Ohio (USA); joint research project
- Reviewer for various journals and conferences
- Board member Master renewal committee
- Board member Bindend Studie Advies committee
- Board member Dissertation Award committee 

Valorisation of research:
- Various guest lectures / invited presentations (amongst others University of Cape Town, Ohio State University, Amsterdam University College, Hogeschool Den Haag, CAMeRA Research Institute Amsterdam)
- Valorisation of research in various media outlets (amongst others, newspapers, radio interviews, documentary)
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor (Social Marketing of Prosocial Behavior; Risk/Health Comm; Media Psychology)

profile_positions.description:
Research: 
- Effects of media models on body perceptions of adolescent girls and how to interfere with (information) labels, peer comments and innovative interventions (Ph.D. project started jan 2010 - finsihed in january 2014: finished in 4 years on 0.5 fte basis)

Teaching: 
- Graduate and undergraduate level (course coordination, development, teaching and evaluation of educational activities (courses taught in Dutch and English, course also provided for Department of Health Sciences); master theses supervision; research master internship supervision)

Other relevant academic activities, amongst others:
- Elected secretary for the Information Systems Division of the International Communication Association
- Research visit to the Ohio State University, Columbus, Ohio (USA); joint research project
- Reviewer
- BSA Commissie
- Board member dissertation award committee 
- Various guest lectures / invited presentations (amongst others University of Cape Town, Ohio State University, Amsterdam University College, Hogeschool Den Haag, CAMeRA Reserach Institute Amsterdam)
